title: Alligator rescued from Charles River
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News After multiple sightings, an animal educator successfully located the small alligator and rescued it from the dangerously cold waters.
This small alligator was spotted in a lagoon along the Charles River Esplanade.
Courtesy of Whitney Lieberman Earlier this week, multiple people reported seeing a small alligator in the water along the Charles River Esplanade.

title: North Shore police arrest alleged computer scammer at victim’s home

bullets: Crime The victim had not yet paid the alleged scammer who had requested $15,000.

title: What plan do the Red Sox have for Kristian Campbell in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan

title: Chaim Bloom reflects on Mookie Betts trade more than 5 years later
author: Conor Ryan

title: MassDOT launches 4th annual ‘Name a Snowplow’ contest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Transportation The contest is accepting name submissions from all Massachusetts students in kindergarten through eighth grade.
MassDOT announced its fourth annual "Name a Snowplow" contest Wednesday.

Steven Senne/AP Photo The Massachusetts Department of Transportation announced its fourth annual “Name a Snowplow” contest for elementary and middle school students statewide, according to city officials.

title: Garrett Crochet finishes second in AL Cy Young Award voting
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox Crochet earned four out of a possible 30 first-place votes for the Cy Young Award.
Garrett Crochet was a force in his first season with Boston.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe Garrett Crochet had a stellar first season with the Red Sox, with the southpaw establishing himself as Boston’s long-awaited ace and one of the top arms in baseball.

title: Woman arrested for alleged attempted carjacking in Dorchester
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The Boston woman allegedly robbed a convenience store at knifepoint before attempting a carjacking down the street.
A Boston woman was arrested Tuesday for attempting a carjacking in Dorchester while armed with a knife, according to police.
Jenisteen Tomlinson, 31, was taken into custody at about 5:30 p.
